column4: Hi everyone, I'm trying to install VirtualBox on Ubuntu 9.10; can someone please teach me how to "compare the MD5 sums" to ensure that I downloaded the correct package?
the open source version of vbox is in the repos iirc
What is the "repos iirc"?
I mean, it's available by default in the ubuntu software manager if i remember correctly
at the terminal, type sudo apt-get install virtualbox
Okay, I will try that now
should be under the main menu, or press Alt+F2 and type VirtualBox
Okay, but how come it didn't show up under my Applications menu?
it should, under "System" maybe?
or "Accessories"
Strange, it's not under either one of those menus
yeah, i remember having that ... maybe restart gnome panel (killall gnome-panel) or just add it to the menu manually
The killall command did the trick - now I've got a new item called System Tools
good stuff.
np
what type of video device is this?
do you have a TV card in the box too?
strange.  try xawtv.  I've had that make non-working video devices start working (some v4l2 init stuff I suspect)
can you explain your problem again, I missed most of what's happening
so what happens currently when you connect the quickcam?  checking the last few lines of dmesg, what driver gets loaded when you plug it in?
how do I check what gets loaded? I don't understand
unplug the cam, replug it, wait 10 seconds maybe and then run "dmesg | tail -n 20"
